name: Mount Kosciuszko
hint: Highest peak on the Australian mainland, in New South Wales

name: Aoraki / Mount Cook
hint: Highest mountain in New Zealand, in the Southern Alps

name: Mount Wilhelm
hint: Highest mountain in Papua New Guinea

name: Mount Taranaki
hint: Symmetrical volcanic peak on New Zealand's North Island, resembling Mount Fuji

name: Mount Giluwe
hint: Second-highest mountain in Papua New Guinea, highest volcanic peak in Oceania

name: Uluru
hint: Iconic sandstone monolith in Australia's Red Centre, sacred to Indigenous people

name: Mount Ruapehu
hint: Highest peak on New Zealand's North Island, an active volcano with ski fields

name: Mount Bogong
hint: Highest peak in Victoria, Australia, in the Alpine National Park

name: Cradle Mountain
hint: Iconic Tasmanian peak, part of the Tasmanian Wilderness World Heritage Area

name: Blue Mountains
hint: Mountain range west of Sydney, known for eucalyptus haze and the Three Sisters
